intro: Zosterophyllanthos cordatus, commonly known as the heartleaf zosterophyllum, is a rare and ancient plant species with unique botanical features. It belongs to the order Zosterophyllophyta, which includes some of the earliest known land plants. The plant exhibits a simple, branching structure with small, heart-shaped leaves that are often submerged in aquatic environments. Its reproductive structures are distinct, featuring sporangia that release spores into the water. This species provides valuable insights into the evolutionary transition from aquatic to terrestrial life in early plant evolution.
